issue.title: Error unlocking wallet: some keys decrypt but not all. your wallet file may be corrupt.
issue.body:
### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [X] I have searched the existing issues

### Current behaviour

My personal computer crashed and I've already imported "wallet.dat" in the latest Bitcoin Core  v26.0.0. It takes time to synchronize the wallet that was about 6 days. 

Anyhow, now my wallet is updated and I can see the correct balance of my Bitcoin in the "Overview section". I have all the needed information which I took as a backup such as "passphrases" and "wallet.dat".

Unfortunately, as I want to receive or send an amount of my Bitcoin, the wallet shows me the error. " Some keys decrypt but not all. your wallet file may be corrupt."


### Expected behaviour

To see the result

### Steps to reproduce

![Forum](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/assets/6789189/2dad357e-8e90-40ab-82c0-085c0e119a75)


### Relevant log output

_No response_

### How did you obtain Bitcoin Core

Pre-built binaries

### What version of Bitcoin Core are you using?

Bitcoin Core version v26.0.0

### Operating system and version

Windows 10 Enterprise 22H2

### Machine specifications

Processor	Intel(R) Core(TM) i7-6700 CPU @ 3.40GHz   3.41 GHz
Installed RAM	32.0 GB (31.9 GB usable)
System type	64-bit operating system, x64-based processor
